page.title: 02Rolvenden Church
page.content: The Anglican Church of{St.Mary the {Virgin}is Rolvenden's oldest building. It is looked after by the Parochial Church Council which has 17 members. This year there was a new Vicar in the Parish, Rev. Peter Hammond. He replaced Rev. John Wright, who had been the Vicar for 10 years. In the Church there is a list of Vicars which goes back to the year 1244, when John de Waddenton was Rector. On Sundays there are usually four services in the Church. (8 a.m. Holy Communion, 10 a.m. Family Service, 11 a.m. Matins(Morning Prayer) or Holy Communion (sung) and 6.30 p.m.Evensong (Evening Prayer) There are also baptisms, marriages and burials at the Church. Because the Church is so old there have been many burials in the large churchyard, which is a quiet, peaceful place.
